item.title: A white van with no plate on front but same number plate on a 2nd van, 18th January
item.description:
There is a white van I think a Vauxhall which has no number plate on the front and the number plate from another vehicle in the same road on the back. It is parked in front of a blue bmw. The license plate belongs to a white flat bed in bexley road and all 3 vehicles have been in possession of the same person. These vehicles are constantly stopping access to resident parking along with various other vehicles being used by the same person
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bexley Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish left on pavement by 5 Shenley Road, 18th January
item.description:
I am writing to raise a complaint regarding ongoing issues with rubbish being left on the pavement outside my neighbouring property (5A Shenley Road, ground floor flat.) As shown in the attached photograph, household waste has been left loose on the public pavement rather than being properly contained. This is unsightly, obstructs the pavement, and poses a clear risk of attracting vermin such as rats and foxes. It also presents a hygiene concern and demonstrates a lack of consideration for neighbouring properties and for pedestrians using the pavement. This is not an isolated incident, and the situation appears to be recurring. The ground floor flat of 5A Shenley Road consistently leave their bins in the way of the pavement, and rubbish and food waste strewn across the street. This is in addition to noise at antisocial hours that I have written to Southwark Council about before. I am concerned that if it continues, it will lead to further environmental health issues and degrade the local area. I would be grateful if the council could investigate this matter and take appropriate action to ensure waste is stored and disposed of correctly in line with local regulations. Thank you for your time and assistance. I look forward to your response.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Shenley Road, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple issues with park, 18th January
item.description:
On Saturday 17th of Jan I visited Cossell park with my children and was shocked at the state of it. Immediately upon entering was a huge pile of sick next to a bin. We found another pile of sick, as well as an empty cigarette packet, and empty alcohol containers in the hut at the top of of the childrens slide. Someone had also left a disgusting carpet at the bottom of the slide that had accumulated loads of dirt and was sodden with water. We also found a dead rat near the community garden, as well as pieces of scrap metal. It was absolutely not in a good enough state for any children to be there, and I'm sure a lot of the local estates and houses regularly use it, as well as the school immediately opposite. I think this park needs some care. Thank you!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodland Trail, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Both gullies on Rectory Lane outside All Stains Church are fully blocked., 18th January
item.description:
Both gullies on Rectory Lane outside All Stains Church are fully blocked. This causes Rectory Lane to flood in this area when it rains and the footpath cannot be used by pedestrians as passing vehicles spray water all over the pavement. Please could the gullies be cleared including the connection to the surface water sewer.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rectory Lane, North Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
